result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Arscolia Brooks

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on November 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:34 PM Defendant Eric Arscolia Brooks appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for public defender services and to file court appointment of counsel paperwork. Remand to branch 1 for scheduling of appointment of counsel. Bond to continue.
records.courtRptr: D Nelson / J Klaren / M Lindbloom

records.addlTxt: 03:30 PM Defendant Eric Arscolia Brooks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Eric Arscolia Brooks.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $3000.00   with conditions, No contact with Co Defendants G.J or A.M.. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Curfew from 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance October 28, 2022 at 3:00 pm.

No contact with Co Defendants G.J or A.M.. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Curfew from 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitoring. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety.
